page.title: 18D.OF E. AWARD SCHEME BURWELL
page.content: {The Duke Of Edinburgh's Award Scheme and{The Burwell Centre}were{started off{by}the former deputy head teacher at the Village College,{Mr Ratcliffe. It operates at{three levels,}bronze, silver and gold.Since the beginning here there have been{258 bronze, 153 {silver and 78 gold award winners.}They have had to{undertake}all kinds of {projects}and learn to be independent on{expeditions}of different distances. Gold winners get to go to{Buckingham {Palace}in order to receive the{Award {from The Duke himself. At present there are{90 people}aged between{14 and 24}taking part.Three adults and three Gold Holders run the organisation which is{based in}the {Village College.
